intro: Carlina tragacanthifolia, commonly known as the woolly cudweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its medicinal properties. Carlina tragacanthifolia is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its name refers to the leaf structure resembling that of the tragacanth plant.
